content.detailedDescription: Both my husband and i looking at big dipper.Big flash below then gone.We both said did you see that. 30 seconds flash to the right then another as if moving east. no plane.Flashes that disappear. glad he saw it too. i have seen this before and reported it. stayed out for awhile. no more flashes.
content.summary: Flash of light below big dipper then gone. no planes. 2 more flashes heading east. flash then disappears.3 times

content.detailedDescription:
Call me..Come see for yourself...Borrowed this phone...My number is (phone number removed from report) 08/31/14 22:44 cdst flg

content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: First saw on.12 th..Have blenders every night...Doing different things now than they have been...Think they are almost done here! hurry..

content.detailedDescription: Outside walking my dog.  very dark night with clear, starry sky.  heard a loud humming noise to the north and looked up and saw what seemed like a large, somewhat white, mostly red, glowing, pulsating, oval object over higgins lake.  when i first saw it, i thought, not a plane, no flashing lights in the night, not a helicopter, couldn't identify it as it was not like anything i ever saw before.  it flew across my path going west and then what was most startling about it was that it just instantly turned to the northwest at a high rate of speed and then it just instantly disappeared, both the sound and light.
content.summary: Bright glowing red and white oval orb.  high rate of speed.  instantly changed direction and disappeared.

content.detailedDescription: Our town had finished it's labor day fireworks show and we were just sitting on my lawn, talking.  suddenly we noticed through the trees behind my building, a red-orange light rise up, over the treeline, and hover.  it hovered for close to 2 minutes.  we speculated that it looked like the flames in a hot air balloon but it was 9 pm, it had been raining and thundering off and on all day, and fireworks had just ended about 15 minutes ago.  i tried to record it on my cellphone but the light looks white or even yellow-ish on camera.  as we're watching, the light suddenly makes a sharply-angled turn (almost like an l), and rapidly flies off and then suddenly just disappears.  seconds later, we see a second red-orange light rise up in the same place where the first one did, but this one did not hover.  it made the same sharply-angled turn and also disappeared.  right before the second light disappeared, the third one rose--again from the same spot-- and made an even sharper-angled turn and disappeared.  the third light was faster.  there was no sound, nothing else in the sky during this, although shortly after the third light disappeared, we did see an airplane because we compared it to what we had just seen.  and though in my pictures and on my video, the light looks white or even yellow-ish, it was actually a vibrant, very bright red=orange.  we wouldn't have noticed it and watched it otherwise.
content.summary: 3 red-orange lights over pompton lakes, nj

content.detailedDescription: Buddy od mine sae it and posted it up on fb he wasn't sure what it was. he was standing outside no windows or anything obstructing or distorting the image.
content.summary: Storage green object in the sky

content.detailedDescription: U cannot protect me from the military, i got somethine they havn't got,i didn't find it it was givein to me i will share with the world so it give's them a acentive to kill me
content.summary: Came out to talk non verbal

content.detailedDescription: Had company over for dinner. we were all out on the porch talking. i have a big unobstructed view across from my house in a rural area. suddenly saw a bright pulsating orange orb moving rather quickly from s to n above treeline. told everyone, "look, look" as i have seen many things in the night sky here and wanted witnessess this time. it moved in a straight line, then slowed, then hovered. moved again for a few seconds, then vanished. duration of sighting: 2 minutes. witnesses: 5. so glad i wasn't the only one to see it this time.
content.summary: Orange pulsating orb near montrose mi. 8/31/14

content.detailedDescription: in south routt county colorado on the evening of 8/29/14 at about 9 pm ish i observed 2 red lights or orbs rapid moving toward me east to west above green ridge.  was in the backyard with our dog and have seen many aircraft and look at the sky often being under a flight path to steamboat springs and a major path to the west coast with higher flights.  (i know what the night sky looks like and what planes, jets and helicopters look like!)  the two red lights came over the ridge getting larger and brighter as they got closer.  i live on the valley floor and look up a thousand feet and maybe 5 miles away from the ridge line.  if you were to imagine a car with brights on moving rapidly closer ( a visual perspective of a car maybe 100 yards away) above the mountain with red instead of white lights on it might provide a image,  except the objects were much further away.  i called to my wife from the back yard expecting a possible low fly over of something that didn't fit anything i had ever seen.  then the lights got brighter for a instant then separated while descending to the north and south at a slight angle.   when they were maybe half way down the ridge the took off rapidly at opposite parallel lines to the valley floor and disappeared.  there is a smaller ridge of mountains between my visual and where i saw the lights but am not sure whether they went behind or disappeared.  the whole incident took place in 10 to 15 seconds max.  i have thought of flares or fire works of which i have seen many but these objects moved much faster with mirrored flight patterns that were not random.  the red orange color was like that of a flare but know nothing that could have made the high speed maneuvers i witnessed.
content.summary: I saw two red lights moving toward me above the mountain ridge line descending then separating

content.detailedDescription: I work nightshift at the airport and i as outside having a cigarette i'm always looking up at the stars as i have a telescope at home and u never know what o might see i also have a constellation app on my ipad and am interested in the constellations i . it happened the night of the meteor shower and i know it definitely wasn't a meteor i was looking up at cassiopeia and the 3 star triangle in its formation when i noticed there was a fourth star making it into a square , i'm quite good with constellations and knew this wasn't right . . all of a sudden the fourth star started to move off fairly quickly towards the north east and then started to zig zag quite dramatically up and down back and forth at some speed leaving a thin wispy cloud like trail behind it . it wasn't a plane or helicopter as they do not work at night at aberdeen airport the only plane that comes in is a freight one and it makes a very loud noise. what i saw was silent it way way to high to be a terrestrial aircraft. i watched it for about 2 minutes zigging and zagging around then it disappeared  i felt quite scared seeing it because i had the strangest feeling it could see me aswell. make of this what u will but i know what i saw. i didn't record it as i only had my phone and it wouldn't have picked it up
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Star like object

content.detailedDescription:
on august 20, 2014, at approximately 10:05 pm, in duxbury ma, i, as well as several others witnessed a strange object glowing a brilliant orange in the sky just above the tree line. immediately we thought it to be a planet but after concluding that it was far too bright to be a planet we continued to observe it.
      after about 30 seconds, remaining in the same location, the light began to dim gradually while retaining its initial color until it was no longer visible, after which it began to immediately glow again, far less bright than before and began to steadily move to the right. as it moved, the object began to change colors from orange to red and back at about a 1 second interval. it was not the light pattern of a plane as the colors and interval were both incorrect. the object followed its course until the tree line obscured it from view. after believing the object to be gone, we left the area.
       after calling the closest airforce base only to find out it was closed, we returned to the same spot about 30 minutes later. to our surprise a faint orange light, in the same position as the earlier one, began to glow brighter and followed the initial pattern, this time moving to the left however until it dissapeared behind the treeline. after this, another appeared more to the right, rising very slowly and then began to follow the original pattern to the right until it seemed to dissappear from view. after this, another appeared in the orginal spot and the pattern was repeated by at least two others. these lights appeared to hover for a longer duration than earlier.  during this time, i recorded two videos of the events. another object appeared far to the right and appeared to move towards our location. after witnessing this, we left.
      about 15 minutes later, we returned and began to watch the objects from a new location approximately 400 feet from the initial location. there we witnessed two dim orange lights above the treeline. one dissapeared from view while the other began to glow suddenly, much to our surprise. around this time, a police helicopter flew toward the area of the lights. the objects and the helicopter did not appear to make contact. after watching the strange lights for about 15 minutes, one began to hover overhead and it appeared to have a cigar shape or at least what appeared to be a tail, although i am not certain of this. this was odd as the videos recorded earlier revealed that the objects were in the shape of a circle flashing orange and white at a short interval. the object now flying near us emmitted a strange humming sound, too quiet to be a helicopter as we heard a helicopter only a few minutes earlier. after this we left the area and i did not see the objects again. the humming sound however occurred throughout the night and was heard by several people throughout different locations in the forest. our group split up and i was told by some of the people that were present during the initial encounter that one of the objects later dipped to avoid a plane. however i am not sure that this happened and do not know the details as i was not present. this happened at least an hour later. at least 9 objects were observed that night by at least 7 people. the majority of these objects appeared in the same location. we were terrified as well as intrigued.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Orange orbs spotted hovering over forest.

content.detailedDescription: My neighbor and i were outside hanging out, he was just passing time as he had to go to work in a couple of hours. during this time he looked to the east side of the sky in the northern celestial hemisphere and saw this cigar shaped object that appeared to be pulsating. the only way i can describe it is to say that it was hovering, at first, with the ends lit a grey color with the middle a black color, switching to the ends black and the middle a grey silver color... the color kept changing silver or grey on the ends black in the middle and the reverse of that. or that it was pulsating. i can not explain it as i (we) have never seen anything like this at all. (my grandfather was a major in the airforce, a fighter pilot and a cargo pilot for sair aviation. i was an infantry marine, all my life i have lived within 5 miles of airports and flown in and been around airplanes and military.) i may have seen one thing like this on a video on you tube but have not been able to find it. i believe it was a video clip from monster quest or ancient aliens. i will continue to look for it and upload it if i do happen to find it... the "pulsating" object was approximately one to two miles away which made its size approximately 3 to 4 times the size of the fuselage of a 747 airliner.  it moved from northeast, south to due east, then back over to north hovering a few spots in between. its speed was between 250 and 500 mph, using the general speed of an airliner at the same height of about 15,000 to 20,000 feet. finally in the north it was hidden by a cloud after about 15 minutes of maneuvering. i have a few other reports to make as well in the same manner. about 6 to 8 times over the last 3 months starting memorial day weekend we have been seeing this bright light in the sky just appear out of nowhere travel a little ways and then disappear or fade away. the first time a beam of light came out of it. at first i thought it was a satellite along with the space station as we saw it simultaneously with the space station, however the nasa satellite charts prove otherwise and the speed and times are too erratic... given the approximate distance of the satellites the object must be at least as high if not a little closer, but that makes the speed of the object to vary from 17,300 to 10,000 to 51,000 mph...Sometimes it moves in 90 degree angles  sometimes it moves in sharp 180 degree turns... if one would spend a week observing the northern celestial hemisphere around cassiopeia toward the east, between the hours of 2145 and 0230 you can be sure to see it at some point at least around where we live in syracuse. thank you very much for your time...
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering,Other
content.summary: My neighbor and i were waiting outside and in the eastern, northeast in the northern celestial hemisphere we noticed a pulsating vertical cigar shaped object

content.detailedDescription:
Was preparing to take star trail images. snapped off a few stills to check the exposure settings then went ahead and took a series of star trail images. when going through the images this morning i came across something that i cannot identify.

just to make to clear i did not see this with my naked eye or even notice it was there. in following image taken shortly after the "ufo" image does not show anything. so it was gone quickly.

camera was on tripod and pointing due east in my backyard.
content.summary: Ufo in images

content.detailedDescription: Experienced an unusual event approximately 5:00a.M. august 28th. my cat wanted to go outside on back deck. while checking on her i observed a crystal clear starry night sky. while looking at orion's belt and andromeda i noticed  to the right of andromeda what i initially thought was the moon obscured by a small cloud. the color was odd with blue and light orange tinge. then i remembered that the new moon phase began 2-3 days before so it was not the moon.I ran inside for binoculars and upon returning noticed the light behind the cloud was dimming. this lasted about two minutes. suddenly there was this bright flash of light from the cloud and no sound  and what looked like a meteor that moved at warp speed toward the horizon or east of my location. at that point i felt like 'this is bizarre,' i waited to post because i wanted to see if others would have witnessed this event also. so far i have seen postings from the same date and time and very similar experiences from other areas in my state and ones bordering my state.
content.summary: Observed rogue cloud on clear night with light behind. light began to fade. sudden bright flash of light, no sound,. object shot warp speed toward horizon/ east

content.detailedDescription: In moving car, saw object in sky ,clear evening no clouds.Didn't know what to think ,have never seen anything like it.Was surprised how primitive it looked. metal dome shape with panels that had edges, was not round. sun was to west making object shine and revealed detail. told driver to look and when i looked back up it was going away to the south and disappeared very fast.My feelings are i cant believe something so junk looking would be in sky and move that fast.Don't know what to think.
content.summary: Passenger in car,looked up saw object hovering,told driver to look object sped off.

content.detailedDescription: I was in my backyard with my son and my dog spanky and i take pictures of the moon and stars and we have seen objects before so i had my camera with me. what first made me notice the object was that it was bright and very low flying. when i first noticed the object, i did not know what it was, but i knew since it was so low that it was not an airplane and or helicopter. the object appeared to be round, glowing and was moving at a decent speed, not knowing what it was i can not say if the speed it was going was normal for the object. it was not falling, it was moving across the sky. spanky started barking, like he always does when he sees a plane or object in the sky, and i said to my son, eric, what's that? i turned my camera to video mode and started filming. my feelings? i was excited, in awe a little bit, nervous because i have seen other objects in the sky and they have always been to far away for me to focus properly, but this was literately over our heads and i was determined to get a photo and or video of it. the object went over my house and out of sight.
content.summary: Was in my backyard with my son and my dog and noticed a glowing moving object

content.detailedDescription:
I was traveling on saltsburg road, penn hills going se with seneca sr. rehab ctr. to my right and observed 3 hovering yellow-red lights over the treetops, about 400 yards away. i pulled over and got out for a better look when another middle-aged driver showed up (no name). observed: black shape like an elongated "v" or arrowhead shape with lights on the corners/ends. craft then moved, very slowly, towards the ne. two lights (front) with one light trailing (back), all three moved at the same time. probably about 5000 ft. since i was at a lower elevation looking towards a half mile hill in height. craft stopped for 2 seconds then moved off again, disappearing into low clouds. i, then, tried to get under it, traveling up saltsburg rd. towards peterman's corner about one mile observing lights (in/out) of cloud-cover then lost to sight. no sound.

time was saturday evening, aug. 29, 2014, 8:58 pm est, clear to light cloud-cover. no pics because of distance.

i'm always observing the sky, even while driving, boating, gatherings. have always reported what i've seen and gotten feedback.
content.summary: Black elongated

content.altitude: 500 Feet or Less, Over 500 Feet (under cloudcover), Over 500 Feet (no cloudcover)
content.detailedDescription: They respond to bright lights by waved or wobbling as the move like a floating balloon or ghost up in the sky. i've seen ones that i thought was a bright star but it was moving so slow i barley noticed it. then it brightened down till i could not see it even with binoculars.
content.summary: It seemed to have appeard out of nowhere, when i was already observing the stars. three and more star like orbs moving across sky silently. some flash once and dissapear and others fade on really bright and then fade off and fanish. they respond to li

content.detailedDescription:
I woke up at around 2am hearing a sound i had never heard , a mix between a phone vibrating on a hard surface and ringing in my ears (which i was experiencing at the time, and i have had no know ear problems) i checked my phone as soon as i woke, like i always do and there were no missed calls or messages or anything to have cause my phone to be causing the vibrating, which at this stage was very loud. 
the bright blue/turquoise beam or light that was lighting up my entire bedroom seemed to dim and then brighten again, i also noticed and felt, as my 2 dogs were on my bed, that they were completely oblivious to the noise and light and that they seemed to be shaking (as if they were cold), but they were completely fast asleep and would not respond to me, me being a 23 year old who had to go to work in only a few more hours dismissed this entire episode and i tried to go back to sleep with the sound buzzing away and light still dimming and re-lighting my room, i eventually rolled onto my back, opened my eyes to see 3, approx 6 ft tall extraterrestrial beings, in my room, 1 standing at my door which was closed and always is at night, another at the foot of my bed and the last standing right beside me looking down at me. i then remember being moved from my bed on to the floor (i felt as though i was literally floating down to the floor)and being dragged by my feet closer to the being at the door, i was completely paralyzed for this entire time, once i was dragged to my bedroom door the being that was standing there knelt down and placed its hand on my chest, i then remember waking up to no noise or light, pitch black room, switching my bedside light on and checking my phone to see that it was 4:30am, i have not been able to go to sleep or  live without the feeling that something is constantly watching me since, and i have had past experiences either with these same beings or others from the same species. 
these being i presume i have seen before, but have dismissed them off as nightmares.
they are around 6 ft tall very thing would probably way in at around 40-50 kg
the had and elongated head black eyes with slits for nostrils that would flare every 4-5 seconds and i did not see any mouth
content.summary: Woke to extremely bright shinning turquoise lighting my entire bedroom

content.detailedDescription: My wife and i were looking at stars when all of a sudden an orange glowing ball flew over our heads.  though it seemed to wobble back and forth, it was headed south in a straight line.   it was visible for approximately 30-seconds and was traveling at a high rate of speed.  it was not a shooting star.
content.summary: My wife and i observed an orange glowing ball fly directly over our heads.

content.detailedDescription: I was sitting near the water looking off into the street. behind the row of houses directly in front of me, a giant triangular beam of blue light opened into the sky. usually in ufo cartoons the beam is coming from the spaceship in the sky and widening at the bottom, but this was reversed, making me believe the air craft had landed. the blue light came to its widest point, flashed a few white lights, became brighter and simultaneously made a buzzing noise. it sounded just like plugging a guitar into an amp.. then the beam closed horizontally and shrunk back to the ground. i looked at my friend said 'that's some alien s**t' and we ran back to the car. i stared out the rear view window to see if maybe it would happen again, but nothing. on the street there were no cars until we reached my house.
content.summary: Triangular beam of light, narrowest from landing point. blue beams and a buzzing noise.

content.detailedDescription: I had just gotten into bed and just turned on my side looking out window. i saw a very orange fireball then it blew-up. everything was very fast.   i thought a plane exploded but there was nothing falling it just went dark like the sky.  it was a distance away but it was bigger then a plane would be at that distance.  i was struck by the vibrant color.  there was a little yellow around it as it seemed to explode.  it happen very quickly.
content.summary: Vibrant orange ball or fireball that exploded. i thought a plane blew up but one it blew up there was nothing in dark cloudless sky.

content.detailedDescription: I was riding in the car to town with my mother. drove approx. quarter mile down the road  from my home. looked up to the left noticed bright balls of lights. bigger balls in middle smaller in outter circle. my eyes took a moment to adjust in the pitch black with storm clouds that the sky was covered in cloud making light seem brighter. noticed plane far off behind lights. appeared above tree line eyes adjusted realized bright larger lights in middle must be bottom and it was angled and smaller outter lights going across. a bolt of lighting hit and it was gone. didnt see it during light must have dissappeared during lightning strike. i opened car window to see if i could hear anything i.E fireworks but it was dead silent. i yelled to my mom driving sitting next to me and said in awe did you see that? she didnt.  only lasted a matter of fifteen seconds at most. complete awe. ive lived in the woods in florida almost my whole life i can tell planes helicopters this was neither. i couldnt think my mind was blank for about two minutes in complete awe.Ive tried rationalizing this i cant figure anything that would make these lights and this low to trees
content.summary: Big balls of bright lights that had yellowish outline realized group of lights must be craft middle ball bottom outer lights middle

content.detailedDescription:
My mom and i were looking out our 2nd story balcony at a beach resort in carlsbad, ca when all of a sudden we noticed a bright orange-yellow ball very high up in the sky slowly moving south. we thought it could be a plane but we would've seen strobe lights. and planes can't suddenly go back words. it disappeared in the night sky begins some clouds heading north. right after it darted back, a plan flew over us from the palamar airport near by. i could tell it was a plane because it had green/red lights and had a propeller noise.

the object  was very bright and  gave me the thought that it was a meteor. that's all i can describe. i know what i saw and i know it wasn't a plane
content.summary: Slowly moved south then quickly darted back north towards camp pendalton and it disappeared in the clouds

content.detailedDescription:
I was walking my dog and stopped to look up at the night sky. i noticed what i thought was a large star in the n west until it began to move after a few seconds viewing. it was going west then it dropped down at an angle and then leveled off again before fading away gradually but quickly. it's flight movements were like no aircraft known to me. this lasted about 30 seconds.

the airport light to the north was brighter than usual tonight, i don't usually notice it much.

interestingly, i had been telling a friend about another time i saw a ufo just before heading home to walk the dog.
content.summary: Stationary star-like light  begins moving to the west after a few seconds observation, drops, fades away quickly

content.detailedDescription:
At approx. 7:45 pm i was preparing to leave my house to head over to the local kinko's.  i was just about to load my car with my laptop's (i was taking two with me), when i noticed this interesting object that i thought at the time was hovering above my neighbor's house across the street.  the fog was in so i could not get a good reading how far it was from me at that time (the fog did clear somewhat towards the end of the 15 minute event).

at first i speculated that it might be someones "toy drone", but wondered why someone would build a "drone" that large.  my neighbor arrived home at about the same time, and he also suggested it might be a "drone".

the object began to move to the left and then to the right and finally returned to it's original location.  it repeated this maneuver several times before beginning to drift westward.  about this time the fog cleared enough so that i could see a little more detail of the object.  at that time, i realized that the object was bigger and further away from me than i first thought.  so, i estimated that it was possibly as large as the coast guard helicopters that i see flying by on occasion, to maybe as large as a 747.

i continued to watch the object until it moved far enough west that the neighbors roof blocked my view.  the object never descended, but appeared to remain a the same attitude.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Unusualy object above ocean beach in san francisco

content.detailedDescription:
My wife and i just walked the dog. nice minnesota night, nothing unusual except for a big moving spotlight thing casting a dull 'flower' pattern on the base of the clouds to the east of us. it's been there for a few days now. 

anyway, my wife started seeing these lights first. at first she said 'was that lightning?' as we were a few minutes into our walk - i didn't see the first few so i said 'i don't know, doesn't seem stormy' and we walked on up the hill towards a school about a mile from home. as we got the school/park area at the top of the hill the sky opens up, not so many trees, and she saw several more and kept saying 'what the heck!?!!', and i finally saw one myself as well.

until i saw it i dismissed them as 'probably shooting stars', but then we started noticing that whatever these were were actually 'shooting' in all different directions, up, down, and sideways. they were super fast, like they were 'dipping out' of the clouds in the eastern sky, 'shooting' straight to the west, and then 'shooting up' back into the cloud base, all in like a half-second. we saw several more of these craft/lights do this, alternating between e-w and n-s trajectories. very strange. 

the 'craft', it they were, were to us just very very bright self-lighted objects, it seemed mostly like a shining (but not 'sparkling') white light with not a lot of detail visible, but to be honest they could've had little green men waving hello at us from an open window and we wouldn't have seen a thing, they were so wicked fast, very bright, and very hard to spot 'on purpose'. 

my wife actually asked me to file a report when i brought up this website and she saw that somebody else of reported something similar.
content.summary: Very bright craft 'shooting' across sky - thought they were meteors but a few went up!?

content.detailedDescription:
5 green lights were seen moving from the sse to the nnw at 10:09 pm on 8/30/2014 in charleston sc.  two groupings were seen, three lights in front, two in rear.  lights were moving relative to each other and stars could be seen between the lights indicating they were not connected by any solid object.  all lights were moving at generally the same speed in the aforementioned direction.  the first three lights moved only slightly in relation to each other.  the trailing two lights moved at great speed in relation to each other, where one light moved 270 degrees around the other light in approximately 10 seconds.  the movement was not in a perfect arch, again suggesting the two were no physically connected.  while the trailing lights were performing the 270 degree movement relative to each other, one of the leading green lights became intensely bright relative to the others.  this could best be described as seeing a laser pointer that was suddenly pointed directly at the observer.  this lasted approximately 5 seconds.  lights did not blink and were constant, and their brightness in comparison to each other was similar, with the exception of the sudden brightening of the one object.  light intensity could be described as that of a slightly brighter than a standard green airplane navigation light at approximately 1,000 to 2,000 feet (as compared to known aircraft landing at chs on most any other night).
absolutely no noise of any kind was heard during the entire sighting.
lights were first seen approximately 45 degrees from directly overhead and it took approximately 60 seconds to move to the corresponding 45 degree angle.  90 degrees were covered in approximately 60 seconds.  the objects were seen for another 90 seconds, moving to the nnw, until they slowly faded from sight.  no additional movement relative to each other was seen at that point.
many flights go over the house in the direction of charleston international airport.  the direction of these lights was different in that it was 30 degrees to the west of the normal flight pattern to the airport.
sky was clear, no clouds.  no haze was observed.
the pattern below generally reflects the relative position of each light although there were subtle variations of this during the observation.  the distance from the lead light to the trailing light was the distance from the pinky to the thumb with full spread of fingers at arm’s length when the objects were directly overhead.  the distance from the two trailing lights to each other was approximately the size of a half dollar at arm’s length.
							x
		x							x
x  						x
								      
given the speed the trailing two objects moved relative to each other, it gave the impression that these objects were not at any appreciable height.  the general speed of the objects across the sky was much slower than an aircraft landing at chs.  a landing aircraft takes approximately 15 seconds to cover the same 90 degree arch these lights covered in 60 seconds.  however, landing aircraft are only visible for approximately 20 to 30 seconds where these lights were visible for 90 plus seconds before they slowly faded into the distance.  that gives the impression these lights were higher in altitude which contradicts the impression of a lower altitude given by the relative movement of the trailing two objects.
my wife observed the objects for 10 to 15 seconds before calling me outside to see them.  we were the only two witnesses that we know of.
content.summary: 5 solid green lights moving from sse to nnw with constant direction and variable relative motion

content.detailedDescription: On 3rd floor apt balcony.  third timem this summer spotting object.  stationary then moved to my right out of sight obscured by tree line.  still behind trees now.  checked phone app to see if it was a star.  apparently not.
content.summary: Third time spotted this semmer.  over trees. flashing lights on sphere.  stationary then moves.

content.detailedDescription: I went out to the driveway to smoke a cig. i was just pacing around like usual, when i saw a very bright white light in the distance that appeared not to move at all for about ten seconds. i then put my cig out and ran inside to tell my parents. my mom came downstairs and i looked out the front window and it had moved since i ran in and we watched it go directly over the house. the window part probably lasted like 3-4 seconds i was trying desperately to make out a shape but i just couldn't because the light was so bright in the front. i also recall seeing blinking lights around it which gave me the sense that it was at least the size of a small plane and was flying very low overhead. i then ran out to the back door and sadly there is a line of tall trees at the end of the backyard so i couldn't really look at it anymore at that point. but i do know that it made no noise. now a little background. i'm 25, and pretty successful. i have always believed that ufo's exist, and i have always believed there is probably alien life somewhere out there. i am a perfectionist and a realist. i have seen some odd things in the sky before, and i look up at the sky pretty often. but everything i have ever seen until now has been explainable by something known. the second i saw that light unmoving in the distance my gut instinct was omg my first ufo sighting. i would not be reporting this if i didn't honestly think it might have been a ufo as i hate wasting mine and other people's time more then anything else. there is a very small chance it could have been a drone as i have never seen one at night or that low, but it seemed much to large to be a drone to me. sadly my total visual site of this thing was maybe like 15-20 seconds on and off. but gut instinct as always served me very well. anyways. just thought i should share my first sighting! :d oh and when i think back, since it went overhead exactly the opposite direction i saw it first, there is a small chance that when i first saw it it was moving in a direct line towards me which gave the allusion of no movement. but again. gut instinct and memory tell me it was not moving originally. oh and this literally like just happened so i'm not just like trying to remember it or something haha
content.summary: Very bright white light, with other blinking lights flying low

content.detailedDescription: We where swimming at my grand parents and i noticed a orange light and i did not see any lights characteristic of a plane so is said "guy look i think it's a ufo!" then my dad saw it and so did my grandma, brother, and sister and we saw as it silently moved south to north and turned red and it disappeared behind the trees.
content.summary: Orange light moved s to n and turned red
